Computational biology lab at Graduate School of Pharmaceutical Sciences, the University of Tokyo and iPS Cell Research and Application (CiRA), Kyoto University, towards understanding a ubiquitous mechanism to regulate intra- and inter-cellular variations.

  We are currently recruiting graduate students. If you are interested in joining our lab, please feel free to contact me at *rkawaguchi-g at cira.kyoto-u.ac.jp*. </br>
  We also welcome research interns (international/domestic as CiRA research intern students and domestic Ph.D researcher as NCGT intern) and JSPS research fellows.</br>

  ・Center for iPS cell research and application, Kyoto University: <a href="https://www.cira.kyoto-u.ac.jp/e/education/graduate.html">Admission information</a> (An information session will be held on on May 11.) </div>
